article.headline: Illinois St. 64, Missouri St. 63
article.story: SPRINGFIELD, Mo. (AP) -- Dom Johnson hit two free throws with 25 seconds left to give Illinois State a 64-63 win over Missouri State on Saturday night. Johnson finished with 23 points to help Illinois State (16-6, 8-3 Missouri Valley) hold off Missouri State (11-12, 4-7). The game had nine lead changes in the second half and was tied eight times, the last time at 58 with 2:54 left. A 3-pointer by Spencer Laurie put Missouri State up 61-60 with 1:49 but Johnson scored with 1:01 left to give Illinois State up 62-61. Two free throws by Chris Cooks gave Missouri State its final lead at 63-62 with 38 seconds left before Johnson's winning free throws. Missouri State had the ball with 15.9 seconds left but a drive and shot by Cooks bounced off the backboard as time expired. Osiris Eldridge had 17 points for Illinois State, and Anthony Slack had 12 rebounds. Dale Lamberth led Missouri State with 20 points, and Deven Mitchell had 13.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
